name: Hard Complete the Lyrics: Carman Style Quiz / Test | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the song "America Again" what does Carman say is "the only hope for America"?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	"America Again" can be found on "The Standard" album. It is a story song about America's need for Jesus. Carman wrote the lyrics to this song.

questions.text: In "The Courtroom" what is the name of the courtroom?
questions.explanation:
Courtroom of Eternity.

	Carman wrote the lyrics for "The Courtroom".  In his music video the story is  played out through the Judge, Satan and Jesus. Carman sings about the importance of having your name in The Lamb's Book of Life. "The Courtroom" can be found on his "Mission 3:16" album.

questions.text: In "Sunday School Rock" what is "the way to win"?
questions.correct: Up with Jesus down with sin
options: Take the car for a spin
Stay away from rum and gin
questions.explanation:
Up with Jesus down with sin.

	Carman wrote the lyrics to "Sunday School Rock". This song can be found on "The Standard" album.  This is a fast paced song in which he says he "is gonna try and reach ya".  Carman started playing the drums at age 5, guitar at age 16 and started singing at age 17.

Righteous Invasion of Truth.

	"R.I.O.T" was written by Carman and is the title track on the "R.I.O.T. album.  Carman's full name is Carman Dominic Licciardello.

questions.text: Who says "Amen Grandpa, preach it" in the song "Lazarus Come Forth"?
questions.explanation:
Jacob.

	"Lazarus Come Forth" was written by Carman and is on his "Comin' on Strong" album. It is a story song with some rap as well.  Carman was born January 19, 1956. He was 65 years old when he passed away.

questions.text: In the song "Who's in the House" who is in the house?
questions.explanation:
J. C.

	"Who's in the House" is a rap song in part and was written by Carman. It can be found on "The Standard" album.   Carman had been diagnosed with myeloma cancer in 2013 and was only given three or four years to live. It went into remission but returned in January 2020 however by June 2020 he was touring at churches again.

questions.text: In the song, "No Plan B" what does Carman sing he "made a choice" to do?
questions.explanation:
Live for Jesus.

	"No Plan B" is the title song of the album by the same name. It was written by Carman as were all the songs on this album. This was his 22nd and final album.

questions.text: Carman sang "Just as I Am" on his "Ultimate Praise" album. Complete this line "oh lamb of God..."
options: I praise You, I praise You
questions.explanation:
I come, I come.

	"Just As I am" is a hymn written by Charlotte Elliot. It was also Reverend Billy Graham's theme song. There are spoken words added in the version by Carman, I cannot find who wrote them but it may have been Carman himself.

questions.text: Who does Carman say he trusts in all the way" in the song "Do I Do"?
options: The President of the United States
questions.explanation:
You, Lord.

	"Do I Do" is on the "Mission 3:16" album. Carman wrote the lyrics to this song. It is all about trusting in Jesus completely.

questions.text: In the song "Sunday's on the Way" who does he say "were planning on having a party one night"?
questions.explanation:
The demons.

	"Sunday's on the Way" is the title track of the album by the same name. It was written by Carman. It is a story song about Jesus' crucifixion, time in the tomb and His resurrection.  It ends with "The Devil hates Sunday. I tell you Sunday is here to stay,"
